resources.string: Get a better understanding about computer network.

ARQs or Automatic Repeat reQuest is an error-control method for data transmission that uses acknowledgements (messages sent by the receiver indicating that it has correctly received a packet) and timeouts (specified periods of time allowed to elapse before an acknowledgment is to be received) to achieve reliable data transmission over an unreliable service.
Typically, it requires the consumer to update its ability to the producer periodically. \n\n“Feedback” system: Tell the sender how much more data can the receiver consume
“Sliding Window” Concept is used for flow control

A routing protocol specifies how routers communicate with each other to distribute information that enables them to select routes between any two nodes on a computer network. Routers perform the "traffic directing" functions on the Internet; data packets are forwarded through the networks of the internet from
router to router until they reach their destination computer. Routing algorithms determine the specific choice of route. \n

DV algorithm with hop count as metric 
 - Infinity value is 16 hops; limits network size 
 - Includes split horizon with poison reverse 

Routers send vectors every 30 seconds 
 - With triggered updates for link failures 
 - Time-out in 180 seconds to detect failures
